title: Mississippi State Men’s Golf Launches Season at Competitive Knoxville Tournament - BVM Sports
text: By the Numbers Mississippi State 's men's golf team kicks off the 2024-25 season at the Visit Knoxville Collegiate, facing a competitive field that includes six ranked teams. Taking place over three days at the Tennessee National Golf Club, the tournament features notable opponents like No. 6 Tennessee and No. 10 Ole Miss. Coach Dusty Smith expresses excitement about the team's preparedness and past successes at this event, where the Bulldogs finished third last year. The lineup combines experienced players and newcomers, with junior Garrett Endicott leading the charge. The competition starts Friday at 10:10 a.m. CT. - 16 teams competing, with six ranked in the top 25 or receiving votes. - Mississippi State finished third at last year's Visit Knoxville Collegiate at 13-under. While Mississippi State has a strong lineup with experienced veterans, the presence of highly ranked teams may pose significant challenges. Competing against host Tennessee and Ole Miss, both ranked in the top ten, adds pressure to perform at a high standard.State of Play - The tournament tees off on Friday at 10:10 a.m. CT. - The course will have modified setups for some holes, enhancing strategic play. As the tournament progresses, MSU will aim to surpass last year's performance and build momentum heading into upcoming fixtures, focusing on consistent play and leveraging their mixed lineup.Bottom Line Mississippi State must embrace its potential and adapt to the competitive landscape to succeed in the Visit Knoxville Collegiate, drawing on past experiences while seeking to elevate their performance among top-ranked foes.
